scenario: User plans a hiking trip with their dog, correcting the destination mid-conversation and asking a multi-hop question.

turns.content: Hi there. My name is Alex. I live in San Francisco and I'm looking to plan a weekend trip. My main hobby is hiking.
Nice to meet you, Alex! San Francisco is a great city. I can definitely help you plan a hiking trip. Where are you thinking of going?
I was thinking of heading to Lake Tahoe. I'll be bringing my dog, Buddy. He's a golden retriever.
Lake Tahoe is a fantastic choice, and it's great that Buddy is coming along! I'll look for some trails that are suitable for a golden retriever. Are you driving?
Actually, I've changed my mind. Let's make it Yosemite National Park instead of Lake Tahoe. It's a bit of a shorter drive.
No problem, Yosemite it is! I've updated your destination. Since you enjoy hiking, are you looking for easy, moderate, or strenuous trails?
Moderate sounds good. By the way, can you remind me what breed Buddy is? I just told you but it slipped my mind.
Of course. Buddy is a golden retriever. I'll find some moderate, dog-friendly trails in Yosemite for you and your golden retriever.

ground_truth_events.expected_fact: The user's name is Alex.
The user lives in San Francisco.
The user's main hobby is hiking.
The user's trip destination is Lake Tahoe.
The user has a dog named Buddy.
The user's dog is a golden retriever.
The user's trip destination is Yosemite National Park.
Buddy is a golden retriever.
ground_truth_events.retrieval_query: What breed is the user's dog, Buddy?

scenario: User provides personal details for recommendations, corrects a hobby, and later asks multi-hop questions about their pet.

turns.content: Hi there! I'm Alex, and I'm from Seattle. I'm looking for some information on local parks. My main hobby is hiking.
Hello Alex! Seattle has some wonderful parks. Are you looking for parks with specific features, like hiking trails?
Yes, exactly! I also have a dog, a golden retriever named Buddy. So, dog-friendly trails are a must.
Great! Dog-friendly hiking trails it is. Discovery Park and Seward Park are excellent choices in Seattle. Does Buddy have any specific needs?

Not really, he's pretty easygoing. He just loves his squeaky squirrel toy. Actually, I said my hobby was hiking earlier, but I've been getting more into kayaking lately. So let's say kayaking is my main hobby now.

Understood, I've updated your hobby to kayaking. For kayaking, Lake Union and Green Lake are fantastic spots, and many areas around them are dog-friendly for when you and Buddy are on land. Is there anything else I can help you with?
That's perfect, thank you! Just to check, what did I say my dog's favorite toy was?
You mentioned that your dog Buddy's favorite toy is his squeaky squirrel.
Great. And what is the favorite toy of the pet belonging to the person from Seattle?
Based on our conversation, the pet belonging to the person from Seattle has a favorite toy, which is a squeaky squirrel.

The user's main hobby is kayaking.
The user's dog's favorite toy is a squeaky squirrel.
